walkthroughs.title: Test Runner Guide
walkthroughs.description: Take your first steps in coding with Test Runnerâ€”an easy and efficient way to ensure your code runs perfectly, right inside a beginner-friendly editor!

steps.title: Install Git
steps.description:
Test Runner requires you to have installed Git on your computer.
[Install Git](command:getting-started-sample.runCommand)

steps.title: Install Node.js and npm
steps.description:
Test Runner requires you to have installed Node.js and npm on your computer
[Install Node.js](command:getting-started-sample.changeSetting)

steps.title: Install Test Runner
steps.description:
Once you have node.js and npm installed in your computer you'll have to install the Test Runner dependency.
[Install Test Runner](command:getting-started-sample.changeSetting)

steps.title: Create a folder
steps.description: Click on the 'Open Folder' button on the top left side of your screen and create (or open) a new folder where you are going to work on your code.

steps.title: Create your Test Cases
steps.description: Create a file with the name 'spec.inout' inside the folder you created (or selected) and add your test cases inputs and their respective expected outputs.

steps.title: Write your code!
steps.description:
Here comes the fun part, coding!
Create a file named 'Solution' in your favorite programming language and write the code you are going to test.

steps.title: Run your tests!
steps.description: Click on the 'Run' button on the left side of your Visual Studio Code screen to check if your code is correct and all your test cases pass.

steps.title: Fail and Learn
steps.description: If one of your test cases didn't pass don't worry. Just correct your mistakes and re-run Test Runner!

steps.title: Help
steps.description:
If you wan't to check back this steps just open the command palette:
In Windows and Linux: Ctrl + Shift + P
In Mac: Shift + Command + P.
Once the interface is displayed on the top of the screen type 'Welcome: Open Walkthrough' and selected that option. Then select 'Test Runner Guide' to review all the steps. Happy coding!
